I know they're nowhere and they don't exist, but if nowhere means that's where they are, that's where I want to be.

author: Henry George

author: Scipio Africanus

author: Ludwig van Beethoven

text: We learn about life not from plusses alone, but from minuses as well.

text: All men's miseries derive from not being able to sit in a quiet room alone.

author: Dirk Benedict

author: David Hume

text: It's important for moms to have alone time. However, that's the first thing that goes on a busy day. Fortunately for me, because of my job, I have to find the time to do it. At least that's the way my mind sees it.

text: Your actions, and your action alone, determines your worth.
author: Evelyn Waugh

text: I never wanted to go on stage alone because if you mess up, who can you blame?

text: The desire to get married, which - I regret to say, I believe is basic and primal in women - is followed almost immediately by an equally basic and primal urge - which is to be single again.

text: I was a little doubtful about the propriety of going to the Mammoth Cave without a gentleman escort, but if two ladies travel alone they must have the courage of men.

text: The people, and the people alone, are the motive force in the making of world history.

text: Not drunk is he who from the floor - Can rise alone and still drink more But drunk is They, who prostrate lies, Without the power to drink or rise.

text: I love my government not least for the extent to which it leaves me alone.

text: All men's misfortunes spring from their hatred of being alone.

text: When one by one our ties are torn, and friend from friend is snatched forlorn when man is left alone to mourn, oh! then how sweet it is to die!
author: Anna Letitia Barbauld

author: Benito Mussolini

text: I'm so secluded. Very alone.

text: Look, if I were alone in the world, I would have the right to choose despair, solitude and self-fulfillment. But I am not alone.

text: Yes, I will bring the understanding of a woman to the Court, but I doubt that alone will affect my decisions.
author: Sandra Day O'Connor

text: Photography can never grow up if it imitates some other medium. It has to walk alone it has to be itself.

text: I cannot live under pressures from patrons, let alone paint.

text: Hiking is the best workout!... You can hike for three hours and not even realize you're working out. And, hiking alone lets me have some time to myself.

text: It is my personality alone that has brought back the waltz and made it a global craze.
author: Andre Rieu

text: My favorite thing is to be alone in a room with a blank paper in front of me and the time to fill it.

text: 'Tis the last rose of summer Left blooming alone All her lovely companions Are faded and gone.

text: When I'm alone, I can sleep crossways in bed without an argument.

text: There are actually quite high profile British TV star cameos in it that you probably wouldn't even notice, that the British wouldn't even notice, let alone the American audience.

text: On the one hand, shopping is dependable: You can do it alone, if you lose your heart to something that is wrong for you, you can return it it's instant gratification and yet something you buy may well last for years.
author: Judith Krantz

text: The White House alone cannot hold its opponents accountable.
author: Paul Weyrich

text: I have two ideas for novels at the moment, neither of them all that conventional, but I'm not ready to choose between them yet, let alone settle down to the process of writing.
author: Jonathan Coe

text: Remember, man does not live on bread alone: sometimes he needs a little buttering up.
author: John C. Maxwell

text: You are never so alone as when you are ill on stage. The most nightmarish feeling in the world is suddenly to feel like throwing up in front of four thousand people.
author: Judy Garland

text: As a body everyone is single, as a soul never.
author: Hermann Hesse

text: When I was old enough to go to movies alone, I got to see 'Frankenstein' and 'Dracula' on the big screen. I just fell in love with them.
author: George A. Romero

text: To the press alone, chequered as it is with abuses, the world is indebted for all the triumphs which have been gained by reason and humanity over error and oppression.
author: James Madison

text: You can't get rid of it with exercise alone. You can do the most vigorous exercise and only burn up 300 calories in an hour. If you've got fat on your body, the exercise firms and tones the muscles. But when you use that tape measure, what makes it bigger? It's the fat!
author: Jack LaLanne

text: Friends are very important to me, and I have always had many of them. There are probably many reasons why this is so, but two seem to me more valid than any of the others I am a naturally friendly person, and I hate to be alone.
author: Georg Solti

text: I never knew I'd be in a musical, let alone win an award for one.
author: Nicole Kidman

text: I'm a happy man, because I am successful in what I do, of course but what makes me most happy is I have people around me that I love and who love me back. This, for me, is the most important thing. Nobody likes to be alone.
author: Novak Djokovic

text: One person alone can't do anything as important as bringing genuine democracy to a country.
author: Aung San Suu Kyi

text: But in the end, in the end one is alone. We are all of us alone. I mean I'm told these days we have to consider ourselves as being in society... but in the end one knows one is alone, that one lives at the heart of a solitude.
author: Harold Bloom

text: Research and development needs permanent tax credits to build the technology that spurs our growth. But no government programs alone can get America's students to study more science and math parents must push and help their children to meet this goal.
author: Ernest Istook

text: I try to push ideas away, and the ones that will not leave me alone are the ones that ultimately end up happening.
author: J. J. Abrams

text: I'm a grown woman and sometimes, I might be a little fat, you know? Am I alone there? Not really.
author: Leighton Meester

text: The object of oratory alone in not truth, but persuasion.
author: Thomas B. Macaulay

text: Your experiences will be yours alone. But truth and best friendship will rarely if ever disappoint you.
author: Anne Lamott

text: It's often just enough to be with someone. I don't need to touch them. Not even talk. A feeling passes between you both. You're not alone.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: It is very frightening to feel alone when you are standing against a rich and powerful person and all his attendant helpers.
author: Gloria Allred

text: We all get stuck. We all lose ourselves a little bit in a fantasy or in our jobs and forget how we feel about other things. It's really important to check yourself, to spend some time alone.
author: Amanda Seyfried

text: But, if you observe children learning in their first few years of life, you can see that they can and do learn on their own - we leave them alone to crawl, walk, talk, and gain control over their bodies. It happens without much help from parents.
author: Daniel Greenberg

text: I think more and more people want to live alone. You can be a couple without being in each other's pockets. I don't see why you have to share the same bathroom.
author: Jeanne Moreau

text: I feel less alone when I read the books of Ratzinger.
author: Oriana Fallaci

text: The Bible was a consolation to a fellow alone in the old cell. The lovely thin paper with a bit of matress stuffing in it, if you could get a match, was as good a smoke as I ever tasted.
author: Brendan Behan

text: Our country will, I believe, sooner forgive an officer for attacking an enemy than for letting it alone.
author: Horatio Nelson

text: I don't understand the Democrats' approach to Social Security in this country, and I'm not alone.
author: William Weld

text: Just as a cautious businessman avoids investing all his capital in one concern, so wisdom would probably admonish us also not to anticipate all our happiness from one quarter alone.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: I think sometimes all you need is to hear someone else say the same thing that you're going through to realize that you're not alone. I try to put some sense of hope into the songs, into whatever the situation is so that it's not just dirt, drudgery and a life of misery.
author: Sarah McLachlan

text: Probably nothing serious or worthwhile can be accomplished without one's willingness to be alone for sustained periods of time, which is not to say that one must live alone, obsessively.
author: Joyce Carol Oates

text: We are ultimately alone in that we are ultimately responsible for ourselves.
author: Robert Zemeckis

text: However, democracy cannot be defined as the existence of parliaments and elections alone.
author: Recep Tayyip Erdogan

text: Work alone will efface the footsteps of work.
author: James Whistler

text: If you are lonely when you're alone, you are in bad company.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

text: When I was working on Eye of the Beholder, I played a character who is so aloof that my whole lifestyle became very aloof. If someone knocked on my door, there was a part of me that went into a rage, because I wanted to be isolated and alone.
author: Ashley Judd

text: I have an internal protectiveness where it's like, if it comes to just me, as frightened as I am of losing someone I love or things going sour or simply being alone, there is a dark place in my brain where I'm like, It could happen and I'm okay, I'm prepared.
author: Lena Headey

text: Nothing makes us so lonely as our secrets.
author: Paul Tournier

text: I'm fiercely independent, but I'm also terrified of being alone.
author: Adam Levine

text: A task becomes a duty from the moment you suspect it to be an essential part of that integrity which alone entitles a man to assume responsibility.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

text: It was either Voltaire or Charlie Sheen who said, 'We are born alone. We live alone. We die alone. And anything in between that can give us the illusion that we're not, we cling to.'
author: Gabriel Byrne

text: I had a very happy childhood, but I wasn't that happy a child. I liked being alone and creating characters and voices. I think that's when your creativity is developed, when you're young. I liked the world of the imagination because it was an easy place to go to.
author: David Walliams

text: There's this thing of you can live in a city and be completely alone, not notice anything going on around you.
author: Simon Pegg

text: I never said, 'I want to be alone.' I only said, 'I want to be left alone.' There is all the difference.
author: Greta Garbo

text: It seems that when you have cancer you are a brave battler against the disease, but when you have Alzheimer's you are an old fart. That's how people see you. It makes you feel quite alone.
author: Terry Pratchett

text: I'm more like my father, personality-wise. But my mom and I get alone really well - obviously, because my mom and my dad get along so well.
author: Jenna Bush

text: What I'm trying to do is get this message out about self-empowerment, entrepreneurial spirit and true Americanism - the way we were when we changed the world, when Edison was alone, failing his 2,000th time on the lightbulb.
author: Glenn Beck

text: Self-reverence, self-knowledge, self-control these three alone lead one to sovereign power.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

text: People used what they called a telephone because they hated being close together and they were scared of being alone.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

text: I think Mr. Wilson will have to be the rest of the way alone.
author: Flip Wilson

text: Everything great in the world comes from neurotics. They alone have founded our religions and composed our masterpieces.
author: Marcel Proust

text: I think the idea that you can go this alone is - was a huge mistake. And unfortunately, there was a price paid in terms of suffering and pain for people in New Orleans.
author: Michael Chertoff

text: Unconditional war can no longer lead to unconditional victory. It can no longer serve to settle disputes... can no longer be of concern to great powers alone.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Faith, mighty faith, the promise sees, And looks to God alone Laughs at impossibilities, And cries it shall be done.
author: Charles Wesley

text: And I don't have any specific steps to take because I don't start the same way every time. But there is a knowing when it's enough and you can leave it alone.
author: Bruce Nauman

text: Be able to live alone, even if you don't want to and think you will never find it necessary.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

text: What is uttered from the heart alone, Will win the hearts of others to your own.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Sometimes I think we're alone. Sometimes I think we're not. In either case, the thought is staggering.
author: R. Buckminster Fuller

text: I learned why 'out riding alone' is an oxymoron: An equestrian is never alone, is always sensing the other being, the mysterious but also understandable living being that is the horse.
author: Jane Smiley

text: I used to wonder if it was God's plan that I should be alone for so much of my life. But I found peace. I found happiness within people and the world.
author: Lana Del Rey

text: I grew up in a very large family in a very small house. I never slept alone until after I was married.
author: Lewis Grizzard

text: We're all outsiders in a way. We're all alone and can become very lonely.
author: Hugo Weaving

text: Whoever thinks that he alone has speech, or possesses speech or mind above others, when unfolded such men are seen to be empty.
author: Sophocles

text: Comics, for me, is being able to sing alone in the shower. I find it freeing. You just pick up a pen and get to it.
author: Shia LaBeouf

text: I'm fortunate that I've been in this business long enough that I've earned the right to be left alone by my record company.
author: Don Henley

text: Young people discovering their sexuality must know they walk with a strong tradition and that they are not alone. They have a right to information without being pressured.
author: Jasmine Guy

text: Nobody was playing the soprano saxophone and certainly nobody was trying to do anything with it. So I was all alone. I didn't know that at first.
author: Steve Lacy

text: Man does not live by soap alone and hygiene, or even health, is not much good unless you can take a healthy view of it or, better still, feel a healthy indifference to it.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

text: I am very averse to bringing myself forward in print, but as my account will only appear as an appendage to a former production, and as it will be confined to such topics as have connection with my authorship alone, I can hardly accuse myself of a personal intrusion.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley

text: Health consists with temperance alone.
author: Alexander Pope

text: An American, a Negro... two souls, two thoughts, two unreconciled strivings two warring ideals in one dark body, whose dogged strength alone keeps it from being torn asunder.
author: W. E. B. Du Bois

text: The only real progress lies in learning to be wrong all alone.
author: Albert Camus

text: I must try and break through the cliches about Latin America. Superpowers and other outsiders have fought over us for centuries in ways that have nothing to do with our problems. In reality we are all alone.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

text: Sometimes I think we're alone in the universe, and sometimes I think we're not. In either case the idea is quite staggering.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

text: Living alone makes it harder to find someone to blame.
author: Mason Cooley

text: Life is so impermanent that it's not about somebody else or things around me, it's about knowing you are completely alone in this world and being content inside.
author: K. D. Lang

text: Virtue alone has majesty in death.
author: Edward Young

text: Tell me who is able to keep his bed chaste, or which goddess is able to live with one god alone?
author: Sextus Propertius

text: Even in the presence of others he was completely alone.
author: Robert M. Pirsig

text: This is nourishing, redemptive we become less alone inside.
author: David Foster Wallace

text: Why is it you feel like a dope if you laugh alone, but that's usually how you end up crying?
author: Chuck Palahniuk

text: What troubles me is the Internet and the electronic technology revolution. Shyness is fueled in part by so many people spending huge amounts of time alone, isolated on e-mail, in chat rooms, which reduces their face-to-face contact with other people.
author: Philip Zimbardo

text: Ah, mon cher, for anyone who is alone, without God and without a master, the weight of days is dreadful.
author: Albert Camus

text: Golf... is the infallible test. The man who can go into a patch of rough alone, with the knowledge that only God is watching him, and play his ball where it lies, is the man who will serve you faithfully and well.
author: P. G. Wodehouse

text: It can be kind of gruesome at times, making things alone.
author: Jenny Holzer

text: Nothing we do, however virtuous, can be accomplished alone therefore we are saved by love.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

text: The biggest opportunity in 2013 is in Africa. It has seven out of the ten fastest-growing economies in the world. In Nigeria alone there are 100 million people with mobile phones. In total, 300 million Africans - five times the population of Britain - are in the middle class.
author: David Miliband

text: Man cannot live by incompetence alone.
author: Charlotte Whitton

text: I never did anything alone. Whatever was accomplished in this country was accomplished collectively.
author: Golda Meir

text: Another thing I like to do is sit back and take in nature. To look at the birds, listen to their singing, go hiking, camping and jogging and running, walking along the beach, playing games and sometimes being alone with the great outdoors. It's very special to me.
author: Larry Wilcox

text: Observe, record, tabulate, communicate. Use your five senses. Learn to see, learn to hear, learn to feel, learn to smell, and know that by practice alone you can become expert.
author: William Osler

text: Perhaps I know best why it is man alone who laughs he alone suffers so deeply that he had to invent laughter.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: You can't fake it when you're alone with God, you know.
author: Jim Bakker

text: If you write a novel alone you sit and you weave a little narrative. And it's O.K., but it's of no account.
author: V. S. Naipaul

text: If it's true that our species is alone in the universe, then I'd have to say the universe aimed rather low and settled for very little.
author: George Carlin

text: We're all in this alone.
author: Lily Tomlin

text: Judaism is much more communal, and partly as a consequence of my religious switch, I am increasingly more suspicous of my previous view that what people do in the privacy of their own home is their business alone.
author: Luke Ford

text: With 'Twilight,' you have these massive tomes that you have to condense. With 'Penoza,' we had an eight episode Dutch series that, just for the pilot alone, I condensed three episodes. So, there's a lot of filling in and a ton of invention that has to happen to fill out eight episodes.
author: Melissa Rosenberg

text: A man is never completely alone in this world. At the worst, he has the company of a boy, a youth, and by and by a grown man - the one he used to be.
author: Cesare Pavese

text: I am alone, some people help me, but, basically, I can do what I want.
author: Sergei Bubka

text: European investment in Texas alone exceeds all U.S. investment in China and Japan put together.
author: John Bruton

text: I'm not someone who likes to have my picture taken, let alone see it plastered all over the place.
author: Laura Linney

text: Wisdom alone is the science of other sciences.
author: Plato

text: Happiness is spiritual, born of truth and love. It is unselfish therefore it cannot exist alone, but requires all mankind to share it.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

text: Woman must have her freedom, the fundamental freedom of choosing whether or not she will be a mother and how many children she will have. Regardless of what man's attitude may be, that problem is hers - and before it can be his, it is hers alone.
author: Margaret Sanger

text: But we cannot rely on memorials and museums alone. We can tell ourselves we will never forget and we likely won't. But we need to make sure that we teach history to those who never had the opportunity to remember in the first place.
author: Dan Rather

text: As the only girl growing up among three brothers, I was always afraid of being excluded. If there was a game to be played, a sport to be learned, a competition to join, I was on my feet and ready. I didn't spend much time alone for fear that I'd miss out.
author: Elisabeth Shue

text: And you know when I was growing up, I knew I wanted to have kids, but I knew I didn't want to do it alone. Then once I was 41, 42, I had to accept that I probably wouldn't have kids unless I decided to adopt later on, but even then it would be with a partner.
author: Rachel Dratch

text: Still, intuitive assumptions about behavior is only the starting point of systematic analysis, for alone they do not yield many interesting implications.
author: Gary Becker

text: He who does not fill his world with phantoms remains alone.
author: Antonio Porchia

text: A man is rich in proportion to the number of things he can afford to let alone.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: I have Graham Greene's telephone number, but I wouldn't dream of using it. I don't seek out writers because we all want to be alone.
author: Patricia Highsmith

text: The most boring scenes are the scenes where a character is alone.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

text: Acquire the habit of speaking to God as if you were alone with Him, familiarly and with confidence and love, as to the dearest and most loving of friends.
author: Alphonsus Liguori

text: If I lived alone, Mom'd never sleep because she wouldn't know I was okay.
author: Scott Baio

text: Recommend to your children virtue that alone can make them happy, not gold.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

text: He alone loves the Creator perfectly who manifests a pure love for his neighbor.
author: Venerable Bede

text: Don't ever let economic alone determine your career or how you spend the majority of your time.
author: Denis Waitley

text: I was a queen, and you took away my crown a wife, and you killed my husband a mother, and you deprived me of my children. My blood alone remains: take it, but do not make me suffer long.
author: Marie Antoinette

text: Trust him not with your secrets, who, when left alone in your room, turns over your papers.
author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

text: I would rather be alone and a loud voice for action than be silent.
author: Susan Rice

text: You can either invade a country or leave them alone and trade with them. When goods cross borders, armies don't.
author: John Stossel

text: It may, however, be said that the level of experience to which concepts are inapplicable cannot yield any knowledge of a universal character, for concepts alone are capable of being socialized.
author: Muhammad Iqbal

text: Inductive reason, which alone makes man master of his environment, is an achievement and when once born it must be reinforced by inhibiting the growth of other modes of knowledge.
author: Muhammad Iqbal

text: The strongest man in the world is he who stands most alone.
author: Henrik Ibsen

text: When anything goes digital, let alone something as immaterial as a book, there is a tendency to see it as just in the air to be taken, and to lose the sense that somebody once made it.
author: Graham Swift

text: Show me a man who lives alone and has a perpetually clean kitchen, and 8 times out of 9 I'll show you a man with detestable spiritual qualities.
author: Charles Bukowski

text: It's better to be unhappy alone than unhappy with someone - so far.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: Unlike a drop of water which loses its identity when it joins the ocean, man does not lose his being in the society in which he lives. Man's life is independent. He is born not for the development of the society alone, but for the development of his self.
author: B. R. Ambedkar

text: To really be centered and to really work well and to think about the kinds of things that I need to think about, I need to spend large amounts of time alone.
author: Donna Tartt

text: Our ideal is to make her ever stronger and better and finer, because in that way alone, as we believe, can she be of the greatest service to the world's peace and to the welfare of mankind.
author: Henry Cabot Lodge

text: Virtue is not left to stand alone. He who practices it will have neighbors.
author: Confucius

text: Jealousy is no more than feeling alone against smiling enemies.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

text: Belief is nothing but a more vivid, lively, forcible, firm, steady conception of an object, than what the imagination alone is ever able to attain.
author: David Hume

text: I just broke up with my boyfriend, and I've been spending more time alone than I'd like.
author: Lucinda Williams

text: Go on thinking that you don't need to be read and you'll find that it may become quite true: no one will feel the need tom read it because it is written for yourself alone and the public won't feel any impulse to gate crash such a private party.
author: Dylan Thomas

text: I like the idea of being alone. I like the idea of often being alone in all aspects of my life. I like to feel lonely. I like to need things.
author: Robert Plant

text: A man is born alone and dies alone and he experiences the good and bad consequences of his karma alone and he goes alone to hell or the Supreme abode.
author: Chanakya

text: Scholarship was one thing, drudgery another. I very soon concluded that nothing would induce me to read, let alone make notes on, hundreds and hundreds of very, very, very boring books.
author: Simon Raven

text: I don't think I ever got the hang of the writers' room. I love collaborating with people, but I really do my best work alone, and I think I would want to - if I did something again, I think I'd want to take total ownership the way Aaron Sorkin or David Kelley does.
author: Diablo Cody

text: Some of us may just, in one-on-one conversations with our family, with our friends, over the back fence with our neighbors, talk about the reality of our lives and realize that we're not alone, that we have a right to be physically safe and emotionally safe in our own homes.
author: Patricia Ireland

text: Woman is fine for her own satisfaction alone. No man will admire her the more, no woman will like her the better for it. Neatness and fashion are enough for the former, and a something of shabbiness or impropriety will be most endearing to the latter.
author: Jane Austen

text: I live to hail that season by gifted one foretold, when men shall live by reason, and not alone by gold.
author: George Linnaeus Banks

text: Today osteoporosis affects more than 75 million people in the United States, Europe and Japan and causes more than 2.3 million fractures in the USA and Europe alone.
author: Gro Harlem Brundtland

text: I have three phobias which, could I mute them, would make my life as slick as a sonnet, but as dull as ditch water: I hate to go to bed, I hate to get up, and I hate to be alone.
author: Tallulah Bankhead

text: I am alone I am always alone no matter what.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: Fear of serious injury alone cannot justify oppression of free speech and assembly. Men feared witches and burnt women. It is the function of speech to free men from the bondage of irrational fears.
author: Louis D. Brandeis

text: Man's ultimate concern must be expressed symbolically, because symbolic language alone is able to express the ultimate.
author: Paul Tillich

text: I believe that no man who holds a leader's position should ever accept favors from either side. He is then committed to show favors. A leader must stand alone.
author: Mother Jones

text: In the laughing times we know that we are lucky, and in the quiet times we know that we are blessed. And we will not be alone.
author: Dar Williams

text: Let your mind alone, and see what happens.
author: Virgil Thomson

text: In a civilized society, all crimes are likely to be sins, but most sins are not and ought not to be treated as crimes. Man's ultimate responsibility is to God alone.
author: Geoffrey Fisher

text: President Johnson did not want the Vietnam War to broaden. He wanted the North Vietnamese to leave their brothers in the South alone.
author: William Westmoreland

text: Our language has wisely sensed the two sides of being alone. It has created the word loneliness to express the pain of being alone. And it has created the word solitude to express the glory of being alone.
author: Paul Tillich

text: Highly educated young people are tutored, taught and monitored in all aspects of their lives, except the most important, which is character building. When it comes to this, most universities leave them alone.
author: David Brooks

text: Now, on nights that I can't sleep, I play video games alone until the morning.
author: Namie Amuro

text: You have to understand the tone of the movie, because if it's supposed to be funny, it can be funny violent like the Home Alone stuff, but you have to really understand the tone of what you're doing and make the action work for that and for the character.
author: David R. Ellis

text: Alone I'm nothing.
author: Robert Plant

text: The next thing I wrote was in a writing class at night school. It was about a poor woman who worked at a dime store and who was all alone for Christmas in Laurel, Mississippi.
author: Beth Henley

text: It's an interesting combination: Having a great fear of being alone, and having a desperate need for solitude and the solitary experience. That's always been a tug of war for me.
author: Jodie Foster

text: The soul that sees beauty may sometimes walk alone.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: The thing I like about baseball is that it's one-on-one. You stand up there alone, and if you make a mistake, it's your mistake. If you hit a home run, it's your home run.
author: Hank Aaron

text: I love my friends and family, but I also love it when they can't find me and I can spend all day reading or walking all alone, in silence, eight thousand miles away from everyone. All alone and unreachable in a foreign country is one my most favorite possible things to be.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: The employee is regarded by the employer merely in the light of his value as an operative. His productive capacity alone is taken into account.
author: Leland Stanford

text: Music is one of those things that make us feel a little less alone in the world.
author: Tom Cochrane

text: I like being alone and I think this movie, as much as it is an investigation of connection and people bonding, I also think it's just as much about loneliness.
author: Jason Schwartzman

text: But Socialism, alone, can bring self-determination of their peoples.
author: Karl Liebknecht

text: I was very happy sitting alone at a dining room table, writing a script.
author: Conrad Hall

text: We allow our ignorance to prevail upon us and make us think we can survive alone, alone in patches, alone in groups, alone in races, even alone in genders.
author: Maya Angelou

text: All species capable of grasping this fact manage better in the struggle for existence than those which rely upon their own strength alone: the wolf, which hunts in a pack, has a greater chance of survival than the lion, which hunts alone.
author: Christian Lous Lange

text: I may be alone in this, but I do sense the power of film, in that movies have the ability to literally change people's minds. That's pretty powerful stuff when you consider that.
author: Nicolas Cage

text: Most of these people who are celebrities now don't do anything to deserve it, so by that fact alone, I don't want to be one.
author: will.i.am

text: I need some isolation, it's necessary to me, that's just who I am. I need to be left alone.
author: Laura Marling

text: Say not that honor is the child of boldness, nor believe thou that the hazard of life alone can pay the price of it: it is not to the action that it is due, but to the manner of performing it.
author: Akhenaton

text: When I walked to school in the mornings I would start out alone but would pick up four other boys along the way. We would set out together after school across the village green.
author: Roald Dahl

text: When I get into bed at night, I hope I don't get into it alone!
author: Calvin Klein

text: What does it mean to not be alone? I've approached that question through music, technology, writing and other means.
author: Jaron Lanier

text: I don't know much about only children. I was the middle one of three, and if ever I was alone with mum and dad, it was a rare moment.
author: Elizabeth Hurley

text: This, and this alone, is Christianity, a universal holiness in every part of life, a heavenly wisdom in all our actions, not conforming to the spirit and temper of the world but turning all worldly enjoyments into means of piety and devotion to God.
author: William Law

text: Christmas lights may be the loneliest thing for me, especially if you mix them up with reindeers and sleighs. I feel alone. I feel isolated. I feel I do not belong.
author: Mira Nair

text: It is not necessary that you leave the house. Remain at your table and listen. Do not even listen, only wait. Do not even wait, be wholly still and alone. The world will present itself to you for its unmasking, it can do no other, in ecstasy it will writhe at your feet.
author: Franz Kafka

text: We are not to give credit to the many, who say that none ought to be educated but the free but rather to the philosophers, who say that the well-educated alone are free.
author: Epictetus

text: And remember don't high post when you're far from home, and high posting when you're all alone.
author: Mos Def

text: No enterprise can exist for itself alone. It ministers to some great need, it performs some great service, not for itself, but for others or failing therein, it ceases to be profitable and ceases to exist.
author: Calvin Coolidge

text: Some players you pat their butts, some players you kick their butts, some players you leave alone.
author: Pete Rose

text: I like to have a massage therapist come to my house, get a massage, take a bath, go to bed. That's a perfect night alone for me.
author: Stacy Keibler

text: Associate yourself with people of good quality, for it is better to be alone than in bad company.
author: Booker T. Washington

text: Autobiography begins with a sense of being alone. It is an orphan form.
author: John Berger

text: No one can arrive from being talented alone, work transforms talent into genius.
author: Anna Pavlova

text: I'm a very brave person. I can go to North Vietnam, I can challenge my government, but I can't challenge the man I'm with if means I'm going to end up alone.
author: Jane Fonda
